citation.article-title: A new filamentous, gliding bacterium, Filibacter limicola gen. nov. sp. nov., from lake sediment.

p.s: Description of Filibacter limicola sp. nov.
Filibacter limicola (li.mi'co.la L. n. limus mud; L. suff. verbal n. cola dweller; M.L. masc. n. limicola mud dweller.
Filaments 1.1 μm x 8-150 μm, cells 1.1 μm x 3-30 μm, rarely less than three diameters in length.
Optimum temperature 20°C, slow growth at 4°C and no growth above 26°C.
Gelatin hydrolysed, but casein and starch not hydrolysed.
Sugars and organic acids not utilized, amino acids only are used as carbon and energy sources.
